revised_title: Hydromagnetic Gravity Inertial Waves and Critical Layers in Solar Helmet Streamers and Magnetic Sectors
tldr: This article explores the behavior of hydromagnetic gravity inertial waves in the solar helmet streamers and magnetic sectors. It demonstrates that these waves exhibit critical layers, which play a crucial role in stabilizing the solar and interplanetary magnetic fields. The study also reveals that at these critical layers, wave energy and momentum fluxes undergo a jump discontinuity, and propagating waves communicate their energy and momentum to the interplanetary magnetic field.
